amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to enhancing and improving the United States Patent and Trademark Office in order to reduce the patent application backlog.

vote.text: Amendment SA 437 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 437 proposed by Senator Peters. (consideration: CR S1964-1965; text: CR S1965) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to enhancing and improving the United States Patent and Trademark Office in order to reduce the patent application backlog.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 437 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 437 proposed by Senator Peters.
